```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
x = -4:4
n = length(x)
f = sample(10:(10+n-1),n)*sample(c(-1,1),n,T)
a = sample(1:4,1)*sample(c(-1,1),1)
fn = rev(f)
fna = fn[x==a]
```

Question
========

Function $f$ is defined by the table below:

```{r,echo=F,warning=F}
library(kableExtra)
df = data.frame(x,f)
colnames(df) = c("$x$","$f(x)$")
kable_styling(kable(df),bootstrap_options = "bordered",full_width = F)
```

Let $a=`r a`$. 

* Evaluate $f(-a)$.


Solution
========

Since $a=`r a`$, we know $-a=`r -a`$. So we evaluate $f(`r -a`)$.

$$f(`r -a`) = `r fna`$$

Thus, $f(-(`r a`))=`r fna`$ and $$f(-a)=`r fna`$$
